response: "{ \"title\": \"Easiest Way to Cross the River\", \"description\": \"You are standing on one bank of a river and want to cross it. You have two stones, but you can only use them to help you cross at most once. Write a function `cross_river` that takes a list of integers representing the depth of the water at each point along the river and returns the index of the shallowest point where you can safely cross the river.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef cross_river(water_levels: list[int)) -> int:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `water_levels` (list[int]): A list of integers representing the depth of the water at each point along the river.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns the index of the shallowest point where you can safely cross the river.\", \"code\": \"def cross_river(water_levels: list[int)) -> int:\\n    # Find the minimum water level\\n    min_water_level = min(water_levels)\\n    # Return the index of the first occurrence of the minimum water level\\n    for i, level in enumerate(water_levels):\\n        if level == min_water_level:\\n            return i\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert cross_river([1, 2, 3]) == 0\", \"assert cross_river([5, 4, 3]) == 2\", \"assert cross_river([10, 20, 30]) == 0\", \"assert cross_river([1, 2, 3, 1]) == 3\"] }"
